channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Metal spiked mesh hanging off fence, 24th September
item.description:
Spiked mesh hanging off the fencing, VERY DANGEROUS and on a route that a person registered Severly Sight Impaired/Blind uses and so is a hazard! Please fix immediately

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
There are stickers on all the traffic lights at the junction of Baker Street & Marylebone road. The stickers are politically motivated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London

item.title: Overgrown hedges hackney council property, 24th September
item.description:
I am training someone blind using their long cane along this pavement to keep them safe, independent and out of the road. These branches are at head height for him and are thorny so are a hazard for him and a barrier to get out

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipped Rubbish Building Up, 24th September
item.description:
More flytipping along Wallhouse Road / Ray Lamb Way. Since you last cleared it it has been steadily building up again and is now across the carriageway again. Reporting twice as when i report in just one place you do not remove the rubbish further down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ray Lamb Way, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
